title: Mitten (William)
body: An English bryologist who studied the Muscineas collected by James Yate Johnson in Madeira. His herbarium was acquired by the New York Botanical Garden in 1906, as stated in a letter written by Professor Cockerell to the Madeiran zoologist A. C. de Noronha. Ref.: Contributions to the cryptogamic flora of the Atlantic Islands. (Linnean Society's Journ. Bot., VIII). V. Godman.

James Yate Johnson: Collected the Muscineas studied by William Mitten

1906: Acquisition of William Mitten's herbarium by the New York Botanical Garden
